item.title: Thesis Progress Update
item.description: Computational Advances in Data-Consistent Inversion Measure-Theoretic Methods for Improving Predictions BET [Butler, Estep, Tavener] Method + Mattis, Graham, Walsh, Pilosov github.com/UT-CHG/BET About Purpose: Implement the novel method developed by the aforementioned authors GNU General Public License First released 2014 Python 2.7, upgraded to 3.6 Overview About/Motivation Git-Based Workflow Contribution, Communication Testing, Coverage, Versioning Pull Requests Continuous Integration Documentation Publishing, Releases, Licenses About/Motivation Reproduce results in research Demonstrate utility of approach Upgrading Python 2.

item.title: LAPACK
item.description: My Brief Experience I was fortunate enough to be funded by Dr. Julien Langou during my summer proceeding entering graduate school. This relief from teaching was especially helpful for my transition into post-graduate education, and I was given the opportunity to explore a number of topics that I knew nothing about. For the first time, I found myself working on an object-oriented task in a programming language that was strongly typed.
